document_metadata.name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: As shown in Fig. 1, we found that this sub-chronic alcohol treatment increased Adnp mRNA levels in the dorsal hippocampus 24 h, but not 2 h after the last alcohol injection, in both male and female mice (one-way ANOVA; males: F(2,10) = 5.94, p < 0.05; post-hoc, p < 0.02. Females: F(2,10) = 5.22, p < 0.05, post hoc, p < 0.05)

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: We found that among male mice, Adnp mRNA levels were increased in the dorsal hippocampus after a 24 h alcohol drinking session, but the level returned to baseline (water-drinking controls) after 24 h of withdrawal (Fig. 2b; one-way ANOVA: F(2,13) = 5.32, p < 0.05, post hoc comparisons, p’s < 0.05)

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: In addition, Adnp expression was increased at the 24 h time point in the NAc of female, but not male mouse (one-way ANOVA; females: F(2,9) = 10.87, p < 0.005; post hoc: p < 0.005; males: p > 0.05).

citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: We found no changes in the expression of Adnp in the VTA (p’s > 0.05).

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: However, in female mice, the expression of Adnp was reduced after a 24-h alcohol-drinking session, and this reduction persisted after a 24-h withdrawal (Fig. 2c; one-way ANOVA: F(2,13) = 7.53, p < 0.01, post hoc comparisons, p’s < 0.05).

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: No changes in Adnp levels were detected in the VTA or NAc (p’s > 0.05).

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: Together, our results indicate that reduced Adnp gene dosage leads to increased alcohol intake in female mice.

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: For example, one of these common genes was transcription factor AP2 beta (TFAP2b), which is downregulated by chronic alcohol exposure [41]. This gene had a 3.8-fold increased expression in female Adnp+/− mice, and in contrast, a five-fold decreased expression in male Adnp+/− mice, as compared to sex-matched Adnp+/+controls.

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: Originally, a reduction of 42% in the cortex, of 38% in cerebellum, and of 50% in hippocampus was observed in the levels of Adnp mRNA in Adnp+/− mice compared with Adnp intact mice

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: Importantly, Adnp+/− females showed higher alcohol consumption and preference, compared to female Adnp+/+ controls, whereas no difference was observed in males.

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: As shown in Fig. 3e, f, we found no difference between genotypes in saccharin or quinine intake, suggesting that the effect of Adnp deficiency is specific to alcohol, and does not apply to sweet reinforcers or bitter-taste solutions

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: As Fig. 4b depicts, over the first 2 weeks of drinking (no treatment or intranasal vehicle treatment) Adnp+/− females showed higher alcohol consumption as compared to their Adnp+/+ littermates, replicating our results above.

citation.db_name: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein (ADNP) is an alcohol-responsive gene and negative regulator of alcohol consumption in female mice.
citation.journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology

links.evidence: These results indicate that restoration of ADNP function by NAP administration rescues the wild type phenotype of the Adnp+/− mice, by reversing the abnormal increase in alcohol intake seen in Adnp haploinsufficient female mice
